page.title: 17COLDHARBOUR VILLAGE
page.content:
Even with new building and re-building, Coldharbour village has remained as picturesque as it was so many years ago. The name "Coldharbour" means "rough shelter for travellers" and the village clings to steep Leith Hill.
The ll acre site of Anstiebury Camp, dating from l800 B.C. provided shelter for the women, children and cattle of the Ancient Britons when absent fighting. Today Anstiebury Farm produces cream and free-range eggs sold in the single village shop. Upper Merriden Farm has no tap water or electricity even now. Squires Farm breeds sheep and polo ponies, whereas Crockers Farm trains racehorses.
